page.title: 13ECOLOGY STUDY IN TIBBERTON
page.content: {MOTORWAY PLANTS}-In a sq.m grid ref 89.4:57.clover,ragwort,ground-ivy, hogweed,ox-eye-daisy,greater-plantain, common vetch,cow-parsley,grass,yellow- mignonette. {WOOD PLANTS}-In a sq.m grid.ref 89.4.5:57.ivy,hedge-parsley, nettle, red-champion,seedy-grass,goose-grass. {HEDGROW PLANTS}-Grid ref.55.4:91.6. We looked at a 5m stretch of hedge noting species of plants:dog rose, white-bryony, bramble,hawthorn. {HEDGE-DATING}-In the middle of the hedge was a young field-maple a small tree that grows to 20m high. The leaves are red when young it's flowers are small,yellow clusters.No other trees were growing in the hedge. As a tree this size takes about a century to grow,we decide the hedge must have been nearly 100 years old.
